questions.question:
Consider the following statements about the use of backpatching in a compiler for intermediate code generation:

(I) Backpatching can be used to generate code for Boolean expression in one pass.
(II) Backpatching can be used to generate code for flow-of-control statements in one pass.

Which ONE of the following options is CORRECT?

(GATE CSE 2025 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Refer to the given 3-address code sequence. This code sequence is split into basic blocks. The number of basic blocks is _________. (Answer in integer)

1001: i = 1
1002: j = 1
1003: t1 = 10*i
1004: t2 = t1+j
1005: t3 = 8*t2
1006: t4 = t3-88
1007: a[t4] = 0.0
1008: j = j+1
1009: if j <= 10 goto 1003
1010: i = i+1
1011: if i <= 10 goto 1002
1012: i = 1
1013: t5 = i-1
1014: t6 = 88*t5
1015: a[t6] = 1.0
1016: i = i+1
1017: if i <= 10 goto 1013


(GATE CSE 2025 SET-1)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following expression: \( x[i]=(p+r) *-s[i]+u / w \). The following sequence shows the list of triples representing the given expression, with entries missing for triples (1), (3), and (6).
\( \begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|} \hline (0) & + & p & r \\ \hline (1) & & & \\ \hline (2) & uminus & (1) & \\ \hline (3) & & & \\ \hline (4) & / & u & w \\ \hline (5) & + & (3) & (4) \\ \hline (6) & & & \\ \hline (7) & = & (6) & (5) \\ \hline \end{array}\)
Which one of the following options fills in the missing entries CORRECTLY?

(GATE CSE 2024 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following pseudo-code.
\( \begin{array}{ll} L 1: & t 1=-1 \\ L 2: & t 2=0 \\ L 3: & t 3=0 \\ L 4: & t 4=4 * t 3 \\ L 5: & t 5=4 * t 2 \\ L 6: & t 6=t 5 * M \\ L 7: & t 7=t 4+t 6 \\ L 8: & t 8=a[t 7] \\ L 9: & if \; t 8 \lt = max \; goto \; L 11 \\ L 10: & t 1=t 8 \\ L 11: & t 3=t 3+1 \\ L 12: & if \; t 3 \lt M \; goto L 4 \\ L 13: & t 2=t 2+1 \\ L 14: & if \; t 2 \lt N \; goto \; L 3 \\ L 15: & max =t 1 \end{array} \)
Which of of the following options CORRECTLY specifies the number of basic blocks and the number of instructions in the largest basic block, respectively?

(GATE CSE 2024 SET-1)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following statements regarding the front-end and back-end of a compiler.

S1: The front-end includes phases that are independent of the target hardware.
S2: The back-end includes phases that are specific to the target hardware.
S3: The back-end includes phases that are specific to the programming language used in the source code.

Identify the CORRECT option.

(GATE CSE 2023)
options:
C.

S1, S2, and S3 are all TRUE.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following ANSI C code segment:

 z=x + 3 + y-> f1 + y-> f2;
for (i = 0; i < 200; i = i + 2) 
{
    if (z > i) 
    {
        p = p + x + 3;
        q = q + y-> f1;
    } else 
    {
        p = p + y-> f2;
        q = q + x + 3;
    }
}
Assume that the variable y points to a struct (allocated on the heap) containing two fields f1 and f2, and the local variables x, y, z, p, q, and i are allotted registers. Common sub-expression elimination (CSE) optimization is applied on the code. The number of addition and the dereference operations (of the form y -> f1 or y -> f2) in the optimized code, respectively, are:

(GATE CSE 2021 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the productions \(A\rightarrow PQ\) and \(A\rightarrow XY\). Each of the five non-terminals A,P,Q,X, and Y has two attributes: s is a synthesized attribute, and i is an inherited attribute. Consider the following rules.

Rule 1: P.i=A.i+2, Q.i=P.i+A.i, and A.s=P.s+Q.s
Rule 2: X.i=A.i+Y.s and Y.i=X.s+A.i

Which one of the following is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2020)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which of the following comment about peep-hole optimization is true?

(ISRO CSE 2018)
options:
A.

It is applied to small part of the code and applied repeatedly

B.

It can be used to optimize intermediate code

C.

It can be applied to a portion of the code that is not contiguous

D.

It is applied in symbol table to optimize the memory requirements.
questions.correct_answer:
A.

It is applied to small part of the code and applied repeatedly
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow
